Title: Lab Safety Fundamentals
Text:
To guarantee absolute laboratory safety, data integrity, and personnel welfare, the following guidelines form the mandatory protocol for all experimental operations. Any deviation constitutes a major breach of research conduct.

A. Qualifications and Procedures

1. Unauthorized work is prohibited. All personnel must adhere to the work permit system.
2. Do not violate, bypass, or damage lockout/tagout procedures.

B. Information and Reporting

3. Do not conceal, delay, or falsify reports of any safety incidents, anomalies, or deviations.

C. Personal Health and Protection

4. Do not enter hazardous areas without proper and effective personal protective equipment.
5. Do not report for work under the influence of alcohol or any medication that impairs mental stability.
6. Do not perform safety-critical tasks while fatigued, in poor health, or under significant emotional distress.

D. Equipment and Authority

7. Do not exceed your authority to alter equipment operating status or system configurations.
8. Do not use uncalibrated, out-of-calibration, or expired instruments and tools.

E. Environment and Responsibility

9. Keep all fire escapes and emergency exits clear. Do not misappropriate or damage fire safety equipment.
10. Do not ignore unsafe acts. Intervene if you see a safety violation. Safety is a shared responsibility.
